input_args.passage: 'Ibn Khaldūn | 14th Century Muslim Historian & Philosopher | Ibn Khaldūn, in full Walī al-Dīn ʿAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan Ibn Khaldūn, (born May 27, 1332, Tunis [Tunisia]—died March 17, 1406, Cairo, Egypt), the greatest Arab historian, who developed one of the earliest nonreligious philosophies of history, contained in his ..., developed one of the earliest nonreligious philosophies of history'
input_args.claim: 'According to citation, Georges-Henri Bousquet is known for his translation work of several Muslim authors, including the Tunisian historian Ibn Khaldun.'
